intro: Sinapis frutescens, commonly known as wild mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow, cruciform flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. Its fruits are short, thick, and cylindrical pods containing several seeds. Sinapis frutescens is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in fields, and it is known for its rapid growth and adaptability.
